intro: Saussurea acrophila, commonly known as the Himalayan flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking purple or red flowers. The plant is adapted to cold, arid environments and thrives in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its rarity and unique habitat, Saussurea acrophila is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
